channel.title: Online Mastering?
channel.description: Wondering if anyone else has used and/or recommends any of the online Mastering services seemingly popping up all over the place? I'm talking services like eMastered, Cloudbounce, or LANDR. Let me know your thoughts!

item.title: Online Mastering?
item.dc:creator: HYDRANS
item.description:
I used landr for a while and I think it worked fine - it was mostly just for making my mix louder and brighter

I think it was a helpful tool while I was still learning how to master

If you want to see some examples, most of the non- Auxy tracks on my profile up to my most recent track are mastered with LANDR

Read full topic

item.title: Online Mastering?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
It’s important to distinguish between mixing and mastering.
None of these tools can polish a mix.

That said, I think most of the reputable AI services will return a result better than the average producer can achieve themselves.

I personally use Grand Finale for all my demos. (LUFS metering FTW!)

Read full topic

item.title: Online Mastering?
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Grand Finale is very good. I’ve also been dabbling in Barkfilter lately. Both are pay once, can’t remember the price of each but they’re both quite good. I’m not sure yet which I like better, haven’t finished any tracks to run through Barkfilter yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Online Mastering?
item.dc:creator: crystldawnmusic
item.description:
LANDR gives you two free ones a month (I think) so that might be worth a look. I’ having trouble uploading past 30 MB, though (I use uncompressed WAVs) so that’s something to think about.

Read full topic

item.description:
Yes it’s IOS @iammane has used it before.

item.title: Online Mastering?
item.dc:creator: Db909
item.description:
Haven’t used them. But Klevgrands mastering app, Grand Finale does a great job, is easy to use, iand you only pay for it once.
